page.title: 02FARMING IN BRADWELL
page.content: We visited Eastles farm in{Bradwell to find out how it was run. The 100 hectare farm is situated on land that gently slopes down towards Breydon Water. The farm manager has a further 140 hectares of land in{Oulton Broad, about eight miles away. This farm is mainly arable and as most of the work is done by machines only a few men are employed. Three men are employed throughout the year and two extra men work there during the winter. The farmhands usually work five days a week unless they are very busy, for example, at harvest time. They work about forty five hours a week, starting at 7.30 a.m. The people we spoke to at the farm all said they enjoyed their work.
